pros:
The pay was good for nurses probably because they’re Union. 

Benefits but that may change since they’re now joined with a health network

Good food in cafeteria
cons:
Nurse-Patient Ratios: For a facility that thrives on becoming Magnet recognized and competing with other hospitals like the nurse to patient ratio is HORRIBLE. 1 nurse to 6 patients on days and up to NINE on nights depending on the number of nurses staffed. That was my deal breaker. Taking care of that many patients can be extremely unsafe depending on the acuity level, and is directly proportional to hospital related issues: medical errors, pressure ulcers, long wait times for meds or discharges, etc.

Nursing Culture: While I did meet some nice nurses during my time, i also felt the nursing culture on every floor( i was float) was very clique-ish, gossipy, and nurses seldom helped each other when their colleague was drowning. Definitely an every man for themselves kind of environment. 

Management is disorganized: the nurse educators in the dept seem to be disorganized. The way they set up orientation, sign offs skills, scheduling was always a mess. They need more structure on how they orient newly hired nurses.

Nurse-physician culture/teamwork: Disconnected. Nurses and providers barely communicate w/ each other unless the patient needs something or is in a critical state. 

Too much emphasis on competition with Yale. Throughout the organization there seems to be this theme to “Beat Yale” from day 1 of your start here. They definitely have a long way to go before they can even match.

pros: Good hourly rate and benefits
cons: Not always able to take breaks

pros: Great team to work with. Energetic and forward thinking.

review_title: Not worth the money and amount of work you have to do

cons: Not enough money for the amount of work you ultimately have to do. Schedule is all over the place, so your sleep cycle will be messed up and your plans. Don't care if you want to go back to school, seems like an "inconvenient" despite orientation video encouraging it...

pros: Nothing about this place is good
cons: Everything, poor management, overly worked, management  never compliments when you go out your way to get the job done, this place sets you up for failure, unfortunately I have to keep this professional  so I can not include names. This offsite location is poorly put together. Far from clean and it unfortunate that patients have to come here and be around filth.  The last supervisor was truly misunderstood and was not given the proper training to run this place because they wanted to run her out of here.  Very sad to see, I hope someone truly see that something is not right with this place since Ive worked here 7 people either relocated or quit. PLEASE SOMEONE look into this

pros: The staff you work with becomes like extended family!
cons: pay was ok. I had a hard time being a single mom on this salary though. Their website says they will pay you more, however I had 3 years experience and 1 year of nursing under my belt and they tried to give me 11/hr. I had to fight to get more.

review_title: I love working here, the staff is my family. The nurse's Union offers fair raises every year.
pros: Clean environment, able to join the union if you're a staff nurse, employee bonuses when hospital meets their HCAPHS goal, valuable resources such as Resource nurse to be able to call upon.
cons: Not knowing what to expect with the merge with Western Connecticut health network. There are rumors about changes coming to the Union and changes to the schedules nurses are allowed to work.

pros: Many different specialities and opportunities for variety, growth, and education.
cons: One supervisor for ENTIRE clinical staff!  She was not adequately trained on that job nor the jobs of the staff she was supervising.  Can't have a clinical supervisor also acting as a corporate liaison tithe physicians.

pros: Fantastic people, really dedicated to the best in patient care and very respectful of one another's contributions. Upper management really listens to input from people who work here.
cons: Cannot think of any downside to working here.

pros: this hospital is a human place the people are very concerned and sympathetic about the people who experience their care and treatment

review_title: I've worked at the Hospital and served on its Board of Directors

cons: There's been some cost-cutting in the past couple of years, but most jobs have been retained.
